Specific Details: Preserve the local community-based infrastructure of youth services led by local people in the forthcoming review of the Youth Service Grant.
DPOs Lobbied: Peter Fitzpatrick|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Declan Breathnach|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Gerry Adams|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Imelda Munster|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Fergus O'Dowd|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Ruairí Ó Murchú|Councillor|Louth County council
Subject Matter: Preserve the local community-based infrastructure of youth services led by local people in the forthcoming review of the Youth Service Grant.
Intended Results: The proposed review of the Youth Service Grant by the DCYA will be extremely important for the delivery of local services by local people in counties around Ireland. Local youth services have a track record of delivery for all young people in their regions. They are a critical piece of social infrastructure providing a visible commitment to young people in local areas. The Youth Service Grant has played a key role in ensuring all this work can be managed and delivered for young people locally.
Lobbying Activities:
Youth Work Ireland - Political Breifing
Buswells Hotel, Dublin 
Wednesday 15th May 2019|Letter|1

Specific Details: Fully implement the recommendations of the National Council for Curriculum & Assessment (NCCA) & the Oireachtas Committee on the Relationships & Sexual Education (RSE) Review
DPOs Lobbied: Gerry Adams|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Imelda Munster|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Peter Fitzpatrick|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Declan Breathnach|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Fergus O'Dowd|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Ruairí Ó Murchú|Councillor|Louth County council
Subject Matter: Fully implement the recommendations of the National Council for Curriculum & Assessment (NCCA) & the Oireachtas Committee on the Relationships & Sexual Education (RSE) Review
Intended Results: Youth Work Ireland has been working locally and nationally with young people on the need to change how relationships and sexuality are taught in schools. The NCCA review and the work of the Oireachtas committee provide an excellent opportunity to address this issue. They have consulted with, and involved, youn commitment to see through its recommendations particularly if the young people involved are to feel that their voices were heard.
Lobbying Activities:
Youth Work Ireland - Political breifing
Bushwells Hotel, dublin
15th May 2019|Letter|1

Specific Details: Respond to youth led climate protests by amending the Climate Act to bring Ireland up to and beyond the EU targets from second last where it currently resides.
DPOs Lobbied: Imelda Munster|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Peter Fitzpatrick|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Gerry Adams|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Ruairí Ó Murchú|Councillor|Louth County council::Declan Breathnach|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Fergus O'Dowd|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Respond to youth led climate protests by amending the Climate Act to bring Ireland up to and beyond the EU targets from second last where it currently resides.
Intended Results: Young people all around Europe are taking the lead on climate change, some walking out of school to voice their frustration with the current political class. It is crucial that decision makers show that they are listening and can offer something for the future. Ireland is increasingly Europe’s climate laggard lying second from bottom of the EU table on emissions according to Climate Action Network EU. The Climate Act is the starting place to raise us from bottom of the class, saving millions
Lobbying Activities:
Youth Work Ireland - Poilitical Breifing
Bushwells Hotel- Dublin
15th May 2019|Letter|1

Specific Details: Request for the retention of the Department of Children and Youth Affairs in the next Government,
DPOs Lobbied: Peter Fitzpatrick|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Ruairí Ó Murchú|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Imelda Munster|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Ged Nash|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Fergus O'Dowd|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Request for the retention of the Department of Children and Youth Affairs in the next Government,
Intended Results: That there is a  Minister for children and young people at the Cabinet table, focusing on those most vulnerable and most need of support. That the needs of children and young people come first
Lobbying Activities:
Re:  Department of Children and Youth Affairs
I am writing to you to formally request the retention of the Department of Children and Youth Affairs in the next Government, following unconfirmed reports that the Department may not survive in the new Government configuration.
We in Youth Work Ireland louth are deeply concerned about reports that the Department of Children and Youth Affairs may be carved up in the next government.  As the largest youth organization in Ireland we cannot support such a proposal.  It is essential that as a country with such a sad record in defending the rights of Children and Young people, that there is a dedicated Department for Children and Young affairs and a dedicated  Minister advocating at the Cabinet table on their behalf.
We know that when responsibility and accountability are fragmented between departments, so too are the services and supports for children and young people. The Covid19 pandemic will have serious repercussions for our society. Childr|Letter|1
